source: Original content based on Kubernetes documentation

questions.title: K8S_POD_001
questions.question: Which command creates a pod named nginx using the nginx:alpine image?
questions.explanation: kubectl run is the command to create and run a pod with specified image.

questions.title: K8S_DEPLOYMENT_001
questions.question: How do you scale a deployment named web to 5 replicas?
questions.explanation: kubectl scale is used to update the number of replicas for a deployment.

questions.title: K8S_SERVICE_001
questions.question: Which service type exposes a service on each node's IP at a static port?
questions.explanation: NodePort exposes the service on a static port (30000-32767) on each node's IP.

questions.title: K8S_NAMESPACE_001
questions.question: Which command lists all pods in all namespaces?
questions.explanation: The --all-namespaces (or -A) flag lists resources across all namespaces.

questions.title: K8S_CONFIGMAP_001
questions.question: Which Kubernetes object stores non-confidential configuration data in key-value pairs?
questions.explanation: ConfigMap stores configuration data that can be consumed by pods as environment variables or volume mounts.

questions.title: K8S_SECRET_001
questions.question: How do you create a secret named db-secret from literal values?
questions.explanation: kubectl create secret generic with --from-literal flag creates secrets from command line values.

questions.title: K8S_LABEL_001
questions.question: Which command shows pods with label app=frontend?
questions.explanation: -l or --selector flag filters resources by label selector.

questions.title: K8S_ROLLING_001
questions.question: What is the default update strategy for Deployments?
questions.explanation: RollingUpdate is the default strategy, gradually replacing old pods with new ones.

questions.title: K8S_PV_001
questions.question: Which access mode allows a volume to be mounted as read-write by multiple nodes?
questions.explanation: ReadWriteMany allows the volume to be mounted as read-write by multiple nodes simultaneously.

questions.title: K8S_INGRESS_001
questions.question: Which Kubernetes resource provides HTTP/HTTPS routing to services based on hostname and path?
questions.explanation: Ingress manages external HTTP/HTTPS access to services with host and path-based routing rules.

questions.title: K8S_RBAC_001
questions.question: Which command creates a service account named myapp?
questions.explanation: kubectl create serviceaccount (or sa shorthand) creates a new service account.

questions.title: K8S_DRAIN_001
questions.question: Before performing node maintenance, which command safely evicts all pods from a node?
questions.explanation: kubectl drain safely evicts pods and marks the node as unschedulable.

questions.title: K8S_TAINT_001
questions.question: Which command adds a taint to prevent pods from being scheduled on node1?
questions.explanation: kubectl taint with NoSchedule effect prevents new pods from being scheduled on the node.

questions.title: K8S_LOGS_001
questions.question: How do you view logs from a container named app in pod mypod?
questions.explanation: kubectl logs with -c flag specifies which container's logs to view in a multi-container pod.

questions.title: K8S_RESOURCEQUOTA_001
questions.question: Which Kubernetes object limits resource consumption in a namespace?
questions.explanation: ResourceQuota limits aggregate resource consumption (CPU, memory, storage) per namespace.
